summary: Diaz Lanz is identified as a former Cuban Air Force officer. According to information relayed by the FBI from a source in Jamaica, Diaz Lanz was alleged to be involved in the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, along with other Cuban exiles, during a Communist Party meeting in the Cuban Embassy. The documents also mention resistance activity against the Castro regime by Cuban refugees and members of the Revolutionary Student Directorate, though Diaz Lanz's direct involvement in these activities is not explicitly stated in these documents.
significance: Diaz Lanz's significance lies in the allegation that he was involved in the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, as reported by an FBI source. This places him within the context of potential Cuban exile involvement in the assassination, though the veracity of the allegation is not confirmed within these documents.
